message.body: (he said that was pretty low for him)
His systolic shouldn't be higher than 120. Otherwise, as he ages, his Bp will get higher, and that spells trouble. Has he checked his kidney function, both BUN and creatinine?

i don’t think so. I will let him know. He is a special case, though, because he has a neurological tremor. So, this might be why his bp is so high. He is also genetically predisposed to high bp. He needs to be on a full dosage of his medication, but it causes the ringing in his years to get worse. He is working with a doctor on that - I think he might need to try a different medication (yet again).
he has a great doctor through Penn (she graduated from columbia).
she’s also v pretty, which means he will keep on going back to her.
